candidates.title: impr/implemented hql testing + multiple HQL fixes
candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->
implemented multiple HQL tests and fixes for failing tests. Creation methods handle property creation correctly instead of defaulting to parameter like access. For loops now use type access for generation instead of generic `data.`.

e.g. generated code is now

```rs
for IterableObjectName { field1, field2 } in SomeIterableThing {
    ...
 }
```

## Related Issues
<!-- Link to any related issues using #issue_number -->

Closes #216 #217 

## Checklist when merging to main
<!-- Mark items with "x" when completed -->

- [ ] No compiler warnings (if applicable)
- [ ] Code is formatted with `rustfmt`
- [ ] No useless or dead code (if applicable)
- [ ] Code is easy to understand
- [ ] Doc comments are used for all functions, enums, structs, and fields (where appropriate)
- [ ] All tests pass
- [ ] Performance has not regressed (assuming change was not to fix a bug)
- [ ] Version number has been updated in `helix-cli/Cargo.toml` and `helixdb/Cargo.toml`
- [ ] Lines are kept under 100 characters where possible
- [ ] Code is good

## Additional Notes
<!-- Add any additional information that would be helpful for reviewers -->

candidates.title: implemented multiple HQL bug fixes, built in embedding functionality and other smaller changed
candidates.body:
This pull request introduces significant updates across multiple files, focusing on enhancing documentation, improving deployment workflows, and expanding the CLI functionality for HelixDB. The most notable changes include the addition of a comprehensive contributors guide, updates to the deployment service for better binary management, and new CLI commands for configuration and offline builds.

### Documentation Improvements:
* Added a detailed `CONTRIBUTORS.md` file, which includes an overview of HelixDB, its project structure, key concepts, architecture flow, development guidelines, and a getting-started guide. This provides a clear roadmap for contributors and developers.

### Deployment Workflow Enhancements:
* Updated the `hbuild_redploy` deployment service to include support for pulling binaries from S3, setting permissions, restarting services, and reverting to the old binary in case of failures. This ensures a more robust and automated deployment process. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L66-R66) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L84-R158) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L127-R173) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L197-R275) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L335-R411)

### CLI Enhancements:
* Introduced a new `Config` command to configure Helix credentials and added support for offline builds in the `build.sh` script. These changes improve usability and flexibility for CLI users. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R35-R37) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-fcd8bb6eefba67f32af81cfc7d7699781c8bee9ccb31dc881d600b3e06e1d4eeL23-R25)
* Enhanced the `Install` and `Redeploy` commands with additional options, such as specifying project paths and remote cluster IDs. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R114-R116) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149)

### Codebase Refactoring:
* Refactored the `hbuild_redploy/src/main.rs` file to improve readability by reformatting error messages and restructuring code blocks. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L143-R194) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L303-R385) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L344-R422)
* Updated the `helix-cli/src/main.rs` file to use `tokio::main` for asynchronous execution, enabling better integration with async workflows.

These changes collectively enhance the developer experience, streamline deployment, and expand the functionality of HelixDB's CLI.## Description

From `graphviz` branch:
- [X] knowledge graph visualization
- [X] general graph visualization
- [X] helix-cli `helix install --dev` flag to pull from dev branch
- [X] analyzer: unknown field of node when filtering secondary indexed field type
- [X] improve embedding model integration and tests
- [X] merge `get_routes` and `debug_trace` into 1 `proc_macros` crate
- [X] remove default secondary index from testing
- [X] `helix visualize` cli command
- [X] move providers to gateway as `embedding_providers`
- [X] set node label for graph vis and number of nodes to show in config
- [X] define embedding model in config

From `del-sql-ingestion`: removed everything todo with native sql ingestion in the main db

## Related Issues
<!-- Link to any related issues using #issue_number -->

Closes #

## Checklist when merging to main
<!-- Mark items with "x" when completed -->

- [ ] No compiler warnings (if applicable)
- [x] Code is formatted with `rustfmt`
- [x] No useless or dead code (if applicable)
- [x] Code is easy to understand
- [x] Doc comments are used for all functions, enums, structs, and fields (where appropriate)
- [x] All tests pass
- [x] Performance has not regressed (assuming change was not to fix a bug)
- [x] Version number has been updated in `helix-cli/Cargo.toml` and `helixdb/Cargo.toml`
- [x] Lines are kept under 100 characters where possible
- [x] Code is good

candidates.title: forgot to flush output bruh
candidates.body: Guy on discord had a problem that `helix delete` was "freezing". the prompt to ask if the user is sure if they want to delete an instance or not was just not showing because `print!` does not auto flush stdout unlike `println!` in rust.

candidates.title: Analyzer improvements and property separation

milestone.title: Initial Release
milestone.description:
This initial release will be a fully featured graph database that can be used for production level use cases.

It is unlikely we will have a query language completed or much query optimisation and the majority of query access will be completed via an SDK. The SDK will likely only be in a single language. 

At the end of this milestone, we aim to be on Phase 4.

candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->
This PR includes the following changes:

- A complete rewrite of the transpiler
- Uses set types to generate directly from meaning less hacky work
around for specific cases
- Uses Wrapper types for references, separators etc to ensure
consistency
- Writes rust code per enum/struct instead of adding strings to global
string that is printed at the end
     - Implements display trait for enums/structs to write rust code 
- Many updates to the analyzer
- Improved error messaging to show more clear messages along with the
full file path for cmd+click access
     - More complete type checking for nested anonymous traversals
- Type checking for variables top level for loops (variables in nested
for loop definitions are not handled yet if they are variables from the
parent for loop)
- Implemented a shortest path function that uses BFS to find the
shortest path between two nodes.
- HQL now allows trailing commas
- You can now define default values in the schema like so:
    ```js
     N::User {
         post_count: U64 DEFAULT 0
     }
     ```
- I have also implemented secondary global indexing which can be used
like so:
    ```js
     // in schema.hx
     N::User {
         INDEX username: String
     }

     // in queries.hx
     QUERY getUserByName(name: String) => 
         users <- N<User>({username: name})
         RETURN users
     ```
- Made properties optional as part of serialization/deserialization into bincode meaning 8 bytes are saved per empty property map. 
- ~20% performance improvement
- more than 23% space saving
## Type of Change
<!-- Mark the appropriate option with an "x" -->

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing
functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Performance improvement
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Other (please describe):

## Related Issues
<!-- Link to any related issues using #issue_number -->

Closes #80 #81 #93 

## Testing
<!-- Describe the tests you ran and how to reproduce them -->

- [x] Unit tests added/updated
- [x] Integration tests added/updated
- [x] Manual testing performed

## Checklist
<!-- Mark items with "x" when completed -->

- [x] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [x] My changes generate no new warnings
- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Additional Notes
<!-- Add any additional information that would be helpful for reviewers
-->

- Prefiltering will come in next release

candidates.title: A bunch of cli fixes, better workflow, update readme
candidates.body:
## Description
- [X] `helix start <id>` doesn't work because stopping instances removes it from the instances.json
- [X] `helix instances` show stopped instances as well
- [X] in confix.hx.json con't put db_max_size under vector config. rename to db_max_size_gb.
- [X] add a `helix save` command to just take the `.mdb` file with you
- [ ] also going to remove `--local` from `helix deploy` flag since we are no longer providing a managed service (BREAKING CHANGE FOR DEMOS)
- [X] introduce a `helix delete <instance_id>` to delete an instance fully AND it's data
- [X] introduce a `helix label <instance_id>` to give an instance a short description if needed
- [X] Removed `helix-lite` dir
- [X] Fix panic and not running, but saying `helix deploy` was successful if `db_max_size` is to big (SET A MAX to 1TB OF STORAGE FOR NOW)
- [X] Added discord online people counter to top of readme
- [X] Fix `helix start` such that it restarts on a new port if default is already taken
- [ ] Make sure `helix install` is pulling from main branch
- [X] Custom `use colored::*;`
- [ ] `helix redeploy` to recompile queries to an already existing instance
- Make sure to update any docs that are effected by these changes
- [ ] Update readme with "our software dna" (need to discuss this still)
- [ ] Update cli version

### Closes issues
#87 #107 #109

candidates.title: Internal benchmarks, testing, cli updates
candidates.body:
## Description
- [X] Move hnsw benchmarks into `hnsw_tests` and not using criterion benches anymore because it reqruies a minimum of 10 samples which is not feasible for testing very large amounts of data
- [X] Moved the generation of ids for vectors straight into `HVector::new` and `HVector::slice` since passing in a custom id doesn't make sense anymore because of the time based uuid now implemented
- [X] Moved and fixed up tests for `vector.rs` to `vector_tests.rs`
- [X] Optimized `vector_core::search_level` with better iterators
- [X] `helix update`
- [X] `helix version`
- [X] cli ./build.sh goes to `.local/bin/` like the curl install
- [X] update helix-cli version
- [X] update helix-db version

ready for v1.0.85 👍

### Issues resolved with this pr
closes #88, closes #124

candidates.title: Impl type checking
candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->
In this PR I have implemented the initial static analyzer for HelixQL. It runs over the parsed AST and returns a Vec of diagnostics that can be displayed. Diagnostics are either Error or warnings. Diagnostics take the following form:

```
error: field `name` was previously excluded in this traversal (in QUERY named `excludedField`)
   ┌─ query.hx:6:36
   │ 
 6 │                 n <- u::!{name}::{name}
   │                                   ^^^^
---> help: remove the exclusion of `name`
   │
 6 - u::!{name}::{name}
 6 + u::{name}
   │    
```
Where it shows you the severity, the reason, the location (and the piece of code where the error is), a hint of how to fix and if possible the actual change that is necessary. 

The interpreter currently correctly checks the following parts of the query language:
- The existence of node types used in To/From edge properties
- The existence of variable names before they are used (needs more thorough checking)
- Type checking property accesses/exclusions (ensures they exist, haven't already been excluded)
- Type checking boolean operations (checks that property access is of correct type to compare against comparison value)

I have also implemented some performance improvements for fetching incoming and outgoing edges by getting all duplicates in one memory access instead of one memory access for each edge. It still lazily decodes.



## Type of Change
<!-- Mark the appropriate option with an "x" -->

- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [x] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [x] Documentation update
- [x] Performance improvement
- [x] Code refactoring
- [x] Other (please describe):

## Related Issues
<!-- Link to any related issues using #issue_number -->

Closes #

## Testing
<!-- Describe the tests you ran and how to reproduce them -->

- [x] Integration tests added/updated
- [x] Manual testing performed

candidates.title: Graph pipelining

milestone.title: Initial Release
milestone.description:
This initial release will be a fully featured graph database that can be used for production level use cases.

It is unlikely we will have a query language completed or much query optimisation and the majority of query access will be completed via an SDK. The SDK will likely only be in a single language. 

At the end of this milestone, we aim to be on Phase 4.

candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->
In this PR, we have implemented 
- pipelined graph traversals
- for loops for HQL 
- pre-filtering and post filtering for ANN Vector searches
- u128 keys instead of string keys
- restructured the LMDB table format to allow for improved performance and better space efficiency. 

The database has been benchmarked which will be released soon

candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->
I have:
- Fixed HBuild to use non-blocking IO via tokio
- I have updated bincode and implemented a serdes wrapper to make it easier to work with and more explicit as to the types
- Updated heed to heed3
- Initial version of sql ingestion engine from @lukasnxyz is being pushed. working on this now.

candidates.title: Improvements/server and general cleanup
candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->

I have:
- improved the http server to use non-blocking IO and use async worker queues to improve throughput and performance.
- removed the issue of double writing vectors if the new random level is 0
- added handling for count traversalValue enum variants in the mixin functions

candidates.title: Implementing cosine similarity & initial hbuild
candidates.body:
## Description
<!-- Provide a brief description of the changes in this PR -->

This pr introduces using cosine similarity to the vector db. tested on 1m vectors and got a search result recall of 0.9982 on the [dbpedia 1m dataset](https://huggingface.co/datasets/KShivendu/dbpedia-entities-openai-1M).

have also implemented an initial hbuild server that acts as an admin server for the instance

chosen_pr.title: implemented multiple HQL bug fixes, built in embedding functionality and other smaller changed
chosen_pr.body:
This pull request introduces significant updates across multiple files, focusing on enhancing documentation, improving deployment workflows, and expanding the CLI functionality for HelixDB. The most notable changes include the addition of a comprehensive contributors guide, updates to the deployment service for better binary management, and new CLI commands for configuration and offline builds.

### Documentation Improvements:
* Added a detailed `CONTRIBUTORS.md` file, which includes an overview of HelixDB, its project structure, key concepts, architecture flow, development guidelines, and a getting-started guide. This provides a clear roadmap for contributors and developers.

### Deployment Workflow Enhancements:
* Updated the `hbuild_redploy` deployment service to include support for pulling binaries from S3, setting permissions, restarting services, and reverting to the old binary in case of failures. This ensures a more robust and automated deployment process. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L66-R66) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L84-R158) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L127-R173) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L197-R275) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L335-R411)

### CLI Enhancements:
* Introduced a new `Config` command to configure Helix credentials and added support for offline builds in the `build.sh` script. These changes improve usability and flexibility for CLI users. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R35-R37) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-fcd8bb6eefba67f32af81cfc7d7699781c8bee9ccb31dc881d600b3e06e1d4eeL23-R25)
* Enhanced the `Install` and `Redeploy` commands with additional options, such as specifying project paths and remote cluster IDs. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R114-R116) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149)

### Codebase Refactoring:
* Refactored the `hbuild_redploy/src/main.rs` file to improve readability by reformatting error messages and restructuring code blocks. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L143-R194) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L303-R385) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L344-R422)
* Updated the `helix-cli/src/main.rs` file to use `tokio::main` for asynchronous execution, enabling better integration with async workflows.

These changes collectively enhance the developer experience, streamline deployment, and expand the functionality of HelixDB's CLI.## Description

From `graphviz` branch:
- [X] knowledge graph visualization
- [X] general graph visualization
- [X] helix-cli `helix install --dev` flag to pull from dev branch
- [X] analyzer: unknown field of node when filtering secondary indexed field type
- [X] improve embedding model integration and tests
- [X] merge `get_routes` and `debug_trace` into 1 `proc_macros` crate
- [X] remove default secondary index from testing
- [X] `helix visualize` cli command
- [X] move providers to gateway as `embedding_providers`
- [X] set node label for graph vis and number of nodes to show in config
- [X] define embedding model in config

From `del-sql-ingestion`: removed everything todo with native sql ingestion in the main db

## Related Issues
<!-- Link to any related issues using #issue_number -->

Closes #

## Checklist when merging to main
<!-- Mark items with "x" when completed -->

- [ ] No compiler warnings (if applicable)
- [x] Code is formatted with `rustfmt`
- [x] No useless or dead code (if applicable)
- [x] Code is easy to understand
- [x] Doc comments are used for all functions, enums, structs, and fields (where appropriate)
- [x] All tests pass
- [x] Performance has not regressed (assuming change was not to fix a bug)
- [x] Version number has been updated in `helix-cli/Cargo.toml` and `helixdb/Cargo.toml`
- [x] Lines are kept under 100 characters where possible
- [x] Code is good

## Additional Notes
<!-- Add any additional information that would be helpful for reviewers -->

chosen_detail.title: implemented multiple HQL bug fixes, built in embedding functionality and other smaller changed
chosen_detail.body:
This pull request introduces significant updates across multiple files, focusing on enhancing documentation, improving deployment workflows, and expanding the CLI functionality for HelixDB. The most notable changes include the addition of a comprehensive contributors guide, updates to the deployment service for better binary management, and new CLI commands for configuration and offline builds.

### Documentation Improvements:
* Added a detailed `CONTRIBUTORS.md` file, which includes an overview of HelixDB, its project structure, key concepts, architecture flow, development guidelines, and a getting-started guide. This provides a clear roadmap for contributors and developers.

### Deployment Workflow Enhancements:
* Updated the `hbuild_redploy` deployment service to include support for pulling binaries from S3, setting permissions, restarting services, and reverting to the old binary in case of failures. This ensures a more robust and automated deployment process. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L66-R66) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L84-R158) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L127-R173) [[4]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L197-R275) [[5]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L335-R411)

### CLI Enhancements:
* Introduced a new `Config` command to configure Helix credentials and added support for offline builds in the `build.sh` script. These changes improve usability and flexibility for CLI users. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R35-R37) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-fcd8bb6eefba67f32af81cfc7d7699781c8bee9ccb31dc881d600b3e06e1d4eeL23-R25)
* Enhanced the `Install` and `Redeploy` commands with additional options, such as specifying project paths and remote cluster IDs. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6R114-R116) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-6b3c14f37290c5226c9e367e4acf9d2e889501c4dd3f20304fccf72350634bf6L137-R149)

### Codebase Refactoring:
* Refactored the `hbuild_redploy/src/main.rs` file to improve readability by reformatting error messages and restructuring code blocks. [[1]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L143-R194) [[2]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L303-R385) [[3]](diffhunk://#diff-a9e70adb2ef91eee760ee34f606128d75db9c179d2a678da44b0e9c9aa828ce4L344-R422)
* Updated the `helix-cli/src/main.rs` file to use `tokio::main` for asynchronous execution, enabling better integration with async workflows.

These changes collectively enhance the developer experience, streamline deployment, and expand the functionality of HelixDB's CLI.## Description

From `graphviz` branch:
- [X] knowledge graph visualization
- [X] general graph visualization
- [X] helix-cli `helix install --dev` flag to pull from dev branch
- [X] analyzer: unknown field of node when filtering secondary indexed field type
- [X] improve embedding model integration and tests
- [X] merge `get_routes` and `debug_trace` into 1 `proc_macros` crate
